questions.uddipok:
Make tag questions with the following statements:
(a) The habit of reading is good, ____ ?
(b) But we hardly find it in us, ____?
(c) Everybody loves a studious student, ____?
(d) We ought to give him books, ____?
(e) Books give us knowledge, ____ ?
(f) To read good books is a choice, ____?
(g) Let us try heart and soul to form this habit, ____ ?

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) The habit of reading is good, isn't it?

(b) But we hardly find it in us, do we?

(c) Everybody loves a studious student, don't they?

(d) We ought to give him books, oughtn't we?

(e) Books give us knowledge, don't they?

(f) To read good books is a choice, isn't it?

(g) Let us try heart and soul to form this habit, shall we?

questions.uddipok:
Change the sentences according to directions.
(a) Strategy is the most important thing in the examination. (Comparative)
(b) No answer in the exam should be elaborated unnecessarily. (Active)
(c) When a student gets the question paper, he should read it attentively. (Simple)
(d) Initially the questions may seem difficult. (Negative)
(e) A student should try to answer all the questions to do good in the exam, (Complex)
(f) If a student answers all the questions correctly, he will get good marks. (Simple)
(g) A student should not write irrelevant answers. (Affirmative)
(h) How irritated the examiners become to see such irrelevant answers! (Assertive)
(i) The examinee should not waste time by doing so. (Passive)
(j) By following the process, every student can achieve a good reșult in an examination. (Negative)

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) Strategy is more important than any other thing in the examination.
(b) Students should not elaborate any answer in the exam unnecessarily.
(c) After getting the question paper, a student should read it attentively.
(d) Initially, the questions may not seem easy.
(e) A student should try to answer all the questions so that he can do good in the exam.
(f) By answering all the questions correctly, a student will get good marks.
(g) A student should write relevant answers.
(h) The examiners become very irritated to see such irrelevant answers.
(i) Time should not be wasted by the examinee by doing so.
(j) Without following the process, no student can achieve a good result in an examination.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Sumon/Sumona and you are a student of Khulna Zilla School. Your common room facilities are not sufficient to meet up your demand. Now, write an application to your Headmaster on behalf of the students requesting him to increase common room facilities as soon as possible.

sub_questions.explanation:
Sumona Akter Class: [Your Class] Roll No: [Your Roll Number] Khulna Zilla School [Date]
The Headmaster Khulna Zilla School Khulna
Subject: Request for Increasing Common Room Facilities
Dear Sir,
On behalf of the students of our school, I would like to bring to your kind attention the inadequate facilities in our school’s common room. As you are aware, the common room is a vital space for students to refresh their minds and engage in recreational activities during breaks. However, the current setup is insufficient to meet the increasing needs of the students.
The common room lacks adequate seating arrangements, indoor game facilities, and updated newspapers and magazines. During recess, it becomes overcrowded, leaving many students without the opportunity to utilize the space effectively. This has a negative impact on our relaxation time, which is essential for maintaining focus and productivity in classes.
We humbly request your kind intervention to enhance the facilities in the common room by providing more chairs and tables, introducing additional indoor games like carrom and chess, and ensuring a regular supply of updated reading materials. These improvements would greatly contribute to the overall well-being and academic performance of the students.
We are hopeful for your understanding and prompt action in this regard.
Thank you for considering our request.
Yours faithfully,
Sumona Akter On behalf of the students Khulna Zilla School

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on- A Book Fair.

sub_questions.explanation:
A Book Fair
A book fair is a kind of fair where different types of books are displayed for sale. Book fair is now held in every city and town too. It has recently become very popular in our country. People go to the fair to find their desired books. In Bangladesh, a book fair is arranged on the occasion of 21 s / 21^{s /} 2 1 s / February, 16 th 16^{\text {th }} 1 6 th December, 26 th 26^{\text {th }} 2 6 th March and Bangla New Year. The fair is held in an open place or in auditorium or in a big hall-room. In our country, the largest book fair is held on the premises of Bangla Academy on the occasion of 21 sh 21^{\text {sh }} 2 1 sh February. All kinds of books such as fiction, drama, poetry, novel, biography, translation, children literature, story books, etc. are usually available in a book fair. A book fair usually remains crowded. People from all walks of life visit the fair. People who are book lovers come to the fair to buy books and to enjoy the fair. Young boys and girls gather here to find out books of their favourite authors. They buy books to present them as gifts to their near and dear ones and for themselves. From the interest and participation of people, the popularity of book fair in our country can be realised. A book fair bears great importance. Moreover, it creates a sense of interest for books among the general people. It is really an exceptional place. It develops and flourishes our reading habits and thus makes us enlightened. It also helps develop our creativity.

After my Honour's and Master's degrees, I shall join a college to teach the students with my best effort. I would like to choose a rural area as my working place.
